intro: Telipogon tabanensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tephroseris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, or grass family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in open, sandy or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
